description: Late Middle English, from Latin cantharides, plural of cantharis.

entries.meaning: Spanish fly, Lytta vesicatoria (syn. Cantharis vesicatoria).
Spanish fly; a vesicant extracted from the beetle, popularly held to have aphrodisiac properties.
examples: I can make the most subtle sauces yield up their secretâ€”whether it be white arsenic, rosalgar, mercury sublimate, or cantharides.
